description: Strand units: Representing and interpreting data

teaching.topicTitle: Introduction to Pie Charts and Trend Graphs
teaching.topicContent: Introduce pie charts and trend graphs as advanced data representation methods.Explain their applications in representing data such as sales per month or rainfall per month.Discuss real-life examples and scenarios where pie charts and trend graphs are commonly used.

Guide students in collecting data and creating accurate pie charts.Teach them to read and interpret pie charts, focusing on proportional representation.Provide examples related to demographics, preferences, or survey results.

Introduce trend graphs and their use in representing trends over time.Discuss data sets such as height or weight in relation to age. Guide students in constructing trend graphs and understanding their significance.

Engage students in reading and analyzing trend graphs.Encourage discussions about the patterns and trends depicted in the graphs.Relate trend graph interpretation to real-world scenarios, such as population growth.

teaching.topicTitle: Compiling and Analyzing Complex Data Sets
teaching.topicContent: Teach students to compile and analyze complex data sets from various sources.Discuss the importance of data reliability and sources of error.Challenge students to analyze and draw conclusions from compiled data sets.

Review the concept of averages and their significance.Guide students in calculating averages from data sets. Encourage them to compare calculated averages with the most frequently occurring items in the data set.

teaching.topicTitle: Solving Practical Problems with Data Sets
teaching.topicContent: Present real-life scenarios involving data sets. Challenge students to solve problems using the data sets they've collected and analyzed. Focus on critical thinking and application of data analysis skills.

Introduce the concept of probability and its relevance in data analysis.Teach students to identify and list all possible outcomes of simple random processes. Engage them in discussions about rolling dice and selecting numbers randomly.

Extend the understanding of probability to calculate the likelihood of different outcomes.Guide students in calculating probabilities for rolling two dice and calculating the total. Encourage them to explore different combinations and outcomes.

teaching.topicTitle: Applying Probability in Games and Scenarios
teaching.topicContent: Present games or scenarios where probability plays a role.Challenge students to calculate probabilities and make predictions.Encourage them to apply their knowledge of probability in real-life situations.

test.description: Put your Data knowledge to the test.

questions.content: In a trend graph showing the population growth of a city over the past decade, the vertical axis represents the population, and the horizontal axis represents the years. What does the horizontal axis represent?
You have a data set of ages: 12, 14, 11, 12, and 15. What is the mode of the ages?
A pie chart represents the distribution of favorite subjects among students. The 'Math' sector covers 36 degrees. What percentage of students chose Math as their favorite subject?
You have a data set of test scores: 85, 88, 90, 84, and 92. What is the mean (average) of the test scores?

A trend graph displays the change in the temperature of a city over a year. The vertical axis represents the temperature, and the horizontal axis represents the months. What does the vertical axis represent?
If you flip two coins and roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of getting a tail on both coin flips and rolling an odd number?
You have a data set of shoe sizes: 5, 7, 6, 5, and 8. What is the median shoe size?
A trend graph shows the attendance at a sports event over a period of time. What information can be derived from the graph?
answers: The change in attendance over time

questions.content: If you roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of rolling a prime number?
You have a data set of the heights (in cm) of students: 140, 142, 138, 136, and 144. What is the range of the heights?

A trend graph displays the change in the stock price of a company over a month. The vertical axis represents the stock price, and the horizontal axis represents the days. What does the horizontal axis represent?
If you roll two fair number dice, what is the probability of getting a sum greater than 9?
A trend graph shows the fluctuation of ocean tides over 24 hours. What information does the graph convey?
answers: Changes in tide levels over time
Wave patterns on the ocean surface
